ygData.subject: Re: 'surface' is Matlab reserved keyword
ygData.msgSnippet: Dave, indeed it is possible to overload a Matlab built-in function. All I got to do was put the Cantera toolbox folder at the beginning of the Matlab path. I

Dave,

indeed it is possible to overload a Matlab built-in function. All I 
got to do was put the Cantera toolbox folder at the beginning of the 
Matlab path. I always put directories of my code (or third parties' 
ones) at the end of the path, so I can prevent exactly the 
overloading of built-in functions or functions from Mathworks 
toolboxes.
So, the problem may be solved this way. But I believe it would be 
better off if third parties' toolboxes needed not to overload a built-
in function, just in case a user needs both of them in his/her code.
Of course in this case it is not likely.

Thanks for your time,

Marcus Vinicius

--- In cantera@yahoogroups.com, David Goodwin <dgoodwin@c...> wrote:
> Marcus,
> 
> I haven't run into this problem before, and have been using that 
> version of Matlab.  Maybe it is an issue of setting the Matlab 
path? 
> I'll look into it, and if necessary change the name.
> 
> Dave
> 
> 
> On Jan 26, 2004, at 3:53 AM, Marcus Vinicius Eiffle Duarte wrote:
> 
> > Hi, folks!
> >
> > I am a new user of Cantera. Just downloaded it and tried the 
demos,
> > when I found an execution error. It seems that Matlab R13 (6.5) 
has a
> > built-in 'surface' function and so there is a name conflict with 
the
> > Cantare toolbox.
> > I wanted to (1) report it, because I don't know if someone else 
did
> > it, and (2) know if there is a newer version of the toolbox with 
the
> > name of this particular function changed (and all the references 
of
> > it in other files).
> > I could just change the names myself and send back the toolbox 
code
> > with the changes, but I guess the maintainer(s) of the code would
> > like to choose the new name of the function.
> > Thank you the great job done in Cantera.
> >
> > Marcus Vinicius
> >
> >
